speaker: Apprentices
lines: Three apprentices argue about whether edges are born or made.
Files sing in three keys; one is wrong on purpose to find the truth.
A bucket of chalk sits between them like a referee.
On the wall: a schedule with 'sleep?' written between 'heat' and 'hammer'.
A boy hums a quench song; the water hums back.
A girl flips a coin and lands it on the edge every time.
They notice you the way steel notices a magnet.
They ask if you want to learn something you can't buy.

choices.text: Catch the coin on the edge.
Carry a billet to the anvil.
